definitions.definition: the physical structure of a person or an animal, including the bones, flesh, and organs.
examples: it's important to keep your body in good condition

definitions.definition: the trunk apart from the head and the limbs.
examples: the blow almost severed his head from his body
synonyms: trunk "he was hit by shrapnel in the head and body"

examples: they found his body washed up on the beach
synonyms: remains; Moreinformalstiff; cadaver "the body was exhumed"

definitions.definition: the physical and mortal aspect of a person as opposed to the soul or spirit.
examples: a duality of body and soul

definitions.definition: a person's body regarded as an object of sexual desire.
examples: he was just after her body

definitions.definition: a person, often one of a specified type or character.
the main section of a car or aircraft.
examples: the body of the aircraft was filled with smoke

definitions.definition: the main or central part of something, especially a building or text.
examples: information that changes regularly is kept apart from the main body of the text

definitions.definition: the part of an e-mail containing the message, as opposed to information such as the subject and sender.
examples: put your name, address, and daytime phone number in the e-mail's body

definitions.definition: a large or substantial amount of something; a mass or collection of something.
examples: a rich body of Canadian folklore

definitions.definition: a group of people with a common purpose or function acting as an organized unit.
synonyms: contingent "the representative body of the employers"

examples: the path taken by the falling body

definitions.definition: a full or substantial quality of flavor in wine.
fullness or thickness of a person's hair.
examples: designed to add body to limp and straight hair

definitions.definition: (in pottery) a clay used for making the main part of ceramic ware, as distinct from a glaze.
give material form to something abstract.
examples: he bodied forth the traditional Prussian remedy for all ills

definitions.definition: build the bodywork of (a motor vehicle).
examples: an era when automobiles were bodied over wooden frames
